quizzes.question: What is the name of the IDE used to create C# programs?
quizzes.textContent:
[h1]Your First C# Program[/h1]

You can run, save, and share your C# codes on our[b] Code Playground[/b], without installing any additional software.
[note]Reference this lesson if you need to install the software on your computer. [/note]
To create a C# program, you need to install an integrated development environment (IDE) with coding and debugging tools.
We will be using [b]Visual Studio Community Edition[/b], which is available to download for free.
After installing it, choose the default configuration. 
Next, click [b]File->New->Project [/b]and then choose [b]Console Application[/b] as shown below: [img id="2981" width="100%"]
Enter a name for your Project and click OK.
[note][b]Console application[/b] uses a text-only interface. We chose this type of application to focus on learning the fundamentals of C#.[/note]

quizzes.question: Every console application in C# should contain:
Which type of application uses a text-only interface?
quizzes.textContent:
[h1]Your First C# Program[/h1]

To run your program, press [b]Ctrl+F5[/b]. You will see the following screen: [img id="2982" width="100%"]
This is a console window. As we did not have any statements in our [b]Main [/b]method, the program just produces a general message. Pressing any key will close the console.
[note]Congratulations, you just created your first C# program.[/note]
